quotes: ZNP and ASP were formed in December 1955 and February 1957, respectively.
ZNP and ASP were formed in December 1955 and February 1957, respectively.

PAFMECA was formed in Mwanza, in September 1958 following a meeting between Nyerere, then leader of the Tanganyika African National Union, and other nationalist leaders from Kenya, Malawi, Uganda, Zanzibar and Zimbabwe.
The African Association was formed in Tanganyika in 1929 as a social and cultural organisation for the African elite living in Tanganyika’s urban areas.
See www.jamiiforums.com/jukwaa-la-historia/611580-usichokijua-kuhusu-dkt-salim-ahmed-salim.html (accessed 28 January 2015).

quotes: Others were the Ali Mahfoudh, who later became a colonel and chief of operations and training in the Tanzania People’s Defence Forces, and Mohammed Ali Foum, who went on to serve in various diplomatic positions at ambassador level in the Tanzanian government.

PAFMECA was formed in Mwanza, in September 1958 following a meeting between Nyerere, then leader of the Tanganyika African National Union, and other nationalist leaders from Kenya, Malawi, Uganda, Zanzibar and Zimbabwe.
Some of these movements were South Africa’s ANC and the Pan-African Congress, Mozambique’s FRELIMO, the South West Africa People’s Organization from Namibia, and the Zimbabwe African National Union.
